message: this might qualify more as a general feature request than an API request per se but...

instead of just being able to look at the topic and say "oh, I have 4 unread topics, there they are" vs "I have 18 unread topics and I only see 4 of them in this tree, so I should probably click on the group name to see *all* of the unread topics in a list"

If, like me, you limit the number of topics displayed in the tree to (say) five topics, then the "total unread for the group" number isn't a good indicator of whether the presented topics are the *only* unread topics.
it requires you to do a bit of mental math: "Okay, it says there's 45 unread messages in the group and I've got 12, 3, 26 and 4 unreads... yep, that's all of them"
similar to the 'groups' dropdown, I'm presenting a tree of the most-recent unread groups/messages.

so while it's the sort of thing that I think the entire site could benefit from (unread for groups in the groups dropdown would be unread-topics), but either way... is there any way that unread-topic-count could be added to a group's payload?
Good idea I think, I could use it too.
yeah, I'll think of how to add this to the group endpoint
right - at least that's where I imagined it would go :-)
okay, I'll see what I can do
Cool. I'll give it a shot when I get home. Thanks.
the response param is "unread_topics_count" in the group response
let me know if you see anything fishy
That's excellent! It really will improve usability
